Text saved: World War II was a very big war in the past. Many countries fought in it.
Terrorism is when people use violence to scare others. They want to change things.

News stories make us think the world is more dangerous now. But there is also some good news.

From the end of World War II to 1990, 30 wars happened. More than 100,000 people died in each war.

Today, there are still wars inside one country. But most countries live together with no fighting now. This is better than in the past.

But terrorism went up a lot in the last few years. From World War II, wars killed many more normal people than soldiers.

But for normal people, the numbers are not all bad. People die more from bad crime. This is nine times more than from fighting about power.

The number of people killed around the world went down a little. In 2000, 8 people died for every 100,000 people. In 2015, it was about 5.3 people.
Feedback received: Grade 2/10 - FAIL
